issue.title: [CF 441] <Put stuff related to progress bar displays here>
issue.body:
Implemented bars as a group display method. This is still extremely prelimanary, and many features have yet to be implemented (animations and text overlays, in particular. I also want to do something more creative with power bars.)

In particular regards to overlay texts, I want to remove the existing stack and label texts, and instead allow as many text overlays on an icon as one desires.

Discuss other features/bugs/etc here.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras | Imported from CurseForge issue #441 | Raw

comments.body:
First of all: Cheer for real Bars! Do you need some inspiration?

  • I've been using ChronoBars for a while now for configurable bars, but compared to TMWs conditions it can't do much.
  • Have you considered dividing TMW into an MVC-Pattern like application? I guess Hermes is perhaps a nice example: It comes with 5 exchangeable views (Bars, CooldownBars, GridBars, GridButtons, Logger) to display the configured spell-cooldowns of your raidgroup.
  • And Gnosis might be an example that some bars displays go beyond what information you could display in a TMW-Button: haste-adjusted channeling- and aura- ticks, recast-advisor (for dots i.e.), static duration & zoom features
Edited Feb 13, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Twister

I'm sorry to have gotten your hopes up, but this just isn't going to happen right now. I took the wrong approach from the start, which just ended up making everything completely fall apart. TMW's framework is going to need a lot of work if this is going to be implemented successfully, and I just don't have that kind of time right now.

I like your idea of an MVC based framework, but quite a bit of work is needed to get to a true MVC implementation. TMW already follows such a philosophy a little but, but it is not nearly modular enough to allow alternate Views just yet.

I will start hacking away at a real framework that will support bars (and other display methods) as time is available, but don't get your hopes up that it will be in the next month, even. It definitely won't be in v5.0.0.

Edited Feb 13, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
